page.title: 01Description of area.
page.content:
The area assigned to Hapton Church of England/Methodist Primary School lies to the south east of Hapton Village, and south-west of Burnley, being about two kilometres from the centre of the town.
It is largely an area of open land about 3/4 of the twelve km^2 block being such. The remaining quarter is mainly residential - being the suburb of Burnley known as Rose Hill.
Of the open land, that above 180 metres above sea level (the majority) is rough moorland, the rest is rough pasture, both are used for grazing sheep. The pasture is enclosed by dry-stone walling and is also used for cows.
